text.14: ذُوْقُوْا فِتْنَتَكُمْۗ هٰذَا الَّذِيْ كُنْتُمْ بِهٖ تَسْتَعْجِلُوْنَ
text.16: اٰخِذِيْنَ مَآ اٰتٰىهُمْ رَبُّهُمْ ۗ اِنَّهُمْ كَانُوْا قَبْلَ ذٰلِكَ مُحْسِنِيْنَۗ
text.17: كَانُوْا قَلِيْلًا مِّنَ الَّيْلِ مَا يَهْجَعُوْنَ
text.23: فَوَرَبِّ السَّمَاۤءِ وَالْاَرْضِ اِنَّهٗ لَحَقٌّ مِّثْلَ مَآ اَنَّكُمْ تَنْطِقُوْنَ ࣖ
text.24: هَلْ اَتٰىكَ حَدِيْثُ ضَيْفِ اِبْرٰهِيْمَ الْمُكْرَمِيْنَۘ
text.25: اِذْ دَخَلُوْا عَلَيْهِ فَقَالُوْا سَلٰمًا ۗقَالَ سَلٰمٌۚ قَوْمٌ مُّنْكَرُوْنَ
text.26: فَرَاغَ اِلٰٓى اَهْلِهٖ فَجَاۤءَ بِعِجْلٍ سَمِيْنٍۙ
text.28: فَاَوْجَسَ مِنْهُمْ خِيْفَةً  ۗقَالُوْا لَا تَخَفْۗ وَبَشَّرُوْهُ بِغُلٰمٍ عَلِيْمٍ
text.29: فَاَقْبَلَتِ امْرَاَتُهٗ فِيْ صَرَّةٍ فَصَكَّتْ وَجْهَهَا وَقَالَتْ عَجُوْزٌ عَقِيْمٌ
text.30: قَالُوْا كَذٰلِكِۙ قَالَ رَبُّكِ ۗاِنَّهٗ هُوَ الْحَكِيْمُ الْعَلِيْمُ  ۔
text.32: قَالُوْٓ اِنَّآ اُرْسِلْنَآ اِلٰى قَوْمٍ مُّجْرِمِيْنَۙ
text.35: فَاَخْرَجْنَا مَنْ كَانَ فِيْهَا مِنَ الْمُؤْمِنِيْنَۚ
text.36: فَمَا وَجَدْنَا فِيْهَا غَيْرَ بَيْتٍ مِّنَ الْمُسْلِمِيْنَۚ
text.37: وَتَرَكْنَا فِيْهَآ اٰيَةً لِّلَّذِيْنَ يَخَافُوْنَ الْعَذَابَ الْاَلِيْمَۗ
text.38: وَفِيْ مُوْسٰىٓ اِذْ اَرْسَلْنٰهُ اِلٰى فِرْعَوْنَ بِسُلْطٰنٍ مُّبِيْنٍ
text.39: فَتَوَلّٰى بِرُكْنِهٖ وَقَالَ سٰحِرٌ اَوْ مَجْنُوْنٌ
text.40: فَاَخَذْنٰهُ وَجُنُوْدَهٗ فَنَبَذْنٰهُمْ فِى الْيَمِّ وَهُوَ مُلِيْمٌۗ
text.41: وَفِيْ عَادٍ اِذْ اَرْسَلْنَا عَلَيْهِمُ الرِّيْحَ الْعَقِيْمَۚ
text.42: مَا تَذَرُ مِنْ شَيْءٍ اَتَتْ عَلَيْهِ اِلَّا جَعَلَتْهُ كَالرَّمِيْمِۗ
text.43: وَفِيْ ثَمُوْدَ اِذْ قِيْلَ لَهُمْ تَمَتَّعُوْا حَتّٰى حِيْنٍ
text.44: فَعَتَوْا عَنْ اَمْرِ رَبِّهِمْ فَاَخَذَتْهُمُ الصّٰعِقَةُ وَهُمْ يَنْظُرُوْنَ
text.45: فَمَا اسْتَطَاعُوْا مِنْ قِيَامٍ وَّمَا كَانُوْا مُنْتَصِرِيْنَۙ
text.46: وَقَوْمَ نُوْحٍ مِّنْ قَبْلُ ۗ اِنَّهُمْ كَانُوْا قَوْمًا فٰسِقِيْنَ ࣖ
text.49: وَمِنْ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ خَلَقْنَا زَوْجَيْنِ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَذَكَّرُوْنَ
text.50: فَفِرُّوْٓا اِلَى اللّٰهِ ۗاِنِّيْ لَكُمْ مِّنْهُ نَذِيْرٌ مُّبِيْنٌۚ
text.51: وَلَا تَجْعَلُوْا مَعَ اللّٰهِ اِلٰهًا اٰخَرَۗ اِنِّيْ لَكُمْ مِّنْهُ نَذِيْرٌ مُّبِيْنٌ
text.52: كَذٰلِكَ مَآ اَتَى الَّذِيْنَ مِنْ قَبْلِهِمْ مِّنْ رَّسُوْلٍ اِلَّا قَالُوْا سَاحِرٌ اَوْ مَجْنُوْنٌ
text.53: اَتَوَاصَوْا بِهٖۚ بَلْ هُمْ قَوْمٌ طَاغُوْنَۚ
text.56: وَمَا خَلَقْتُ الْجِنَّ وَالْاِنْسَ اِلَّا لِيَعْبُدُوْنِ
text.57: مَآ اُرِيْدُ مِنْهُمْ مِّنْ رِّزْقٍ وَّمَآ اُرِيْدُ اَنْ يُّطْعِمُوْنِ
text.58: اِنَّ اللّٰهَ هُوَ الرَّزَّاقُ ذُو الْقُوَّةِ الْمَتِيْنُ
text.59: فَاِنَّ لِلَّذِيْنَ ظَلَمُوْا ذَنُوْبًا مِّثْلَ ذَنُوْبِ اَصْحٰبِهِمْ فَلَا يَسْتَعْجِلُوْنِ
text.60: فَوَيْلٌ لِّلَّذِيْنَ كَفَرُوْا مِنْ يَّوْمِهِمُ الَّذِيْ يُوْعَدُوْنَ ࣖ

text.5: sungguh, apa yang dijanjikan kepadamu pasti benar,
text.8: sungguh, kamu benar-benar dalam keadaan berbeda-beda pendapat,
text.9: dipalingkan darinya (Al-Qur'an dan Rasul) orang yang dipalingkan.
text.11: (yaitu) orang-orang yang terbenam dalam kebodohan dan kelalaian,
text.13: (Hari pembalasan itu ialah) pada hari (ketika) mereka diazab di dalam api neraka.
text.14: (Dikatakan kepada mereka), “Rasakanlah azabmu ini. Inilah azab yang dahulu kamu minta agar disegerakan.”
text.15: Sesungguhnya orang-orang yang bertakwa berada di dalam taman-taman (surga) dan mata air,
text.16: mereka mengambil apa yang diberikan Tuhan kepada mereka. Sesungguhnya mereka sebelum itu (di dunia) adalah orang-orang yang berbuat baik;
text.17: mereka sedikit sekali tidur pada waktu malam;
text.18: dan pada akhir malam mereka memohon ampunan (kepada Allah).
text.19: Dan pada harta benda mereka ada hak untuk orang miskin yang meminta dan orang miskin yang tidak meminta.
text.20: Dan di bumi terdapat tanda-tanda (kebesaran Allah) bagi orang-orang yang yakin,
text.21: dan (juga) pada dirimu sendiri. Maka apakah kamu tidak memperhatikan?
text.22: Dan di langit terdapat (sebab-sebab) rezekimu dan apa yang dijanjikan kepadamu.
text.23: Maka demi Tuhan langit dan bumi, sungguh, apa yang dijanjikan itu pasti terjadi seperti apa yang kamu ucapkan.
text.24: Sudahkah sampai kepadamu (Muhammad) cerita tamu Ibrahim (malaikat-malaikat) yang dimuliakan?
text.25: (Ingatlah) ketika mereka masuk ke tempatnya lalu mengucapkan, “Salaman” (salam), Ibrahim menjawab, “Salamun” (salam). (Mereka itu) orang-orang yang belum dikenalnya.
text.26: Maka diam-diam dia (Ibrahim) pergi menemui keluarganya, kemudian dibawanya daging anak sapi gemuk (yang dibakar),
text.27: lalu dihidangkannya kepada mereka (tetapi mereka tidak mau makan). Ibrahim berkata, “Mengapa tidak kamu makan.”
text.28: Maka dia (Ibrahim) merasa takut terhadap mereka. Mereka berkata, “Janganlah kamu takut,” dan mereka memberi kabar gembira kepadanya dengan (kelahiran) seorang anak yang alim (Ishak).
text.29: Kemudian istrinya datang memekik (tercengang) lalu menepuk wajahnya sendiri seraya berkata, “(Aku ini) seorang perempuan tua yang mandul.”
text.30: Mereka berkata, “Demikianlah Tuhanmu berfirman. Sungguh, Dialah Yang Mahabijaksana, Maha Mengetahui.”
text.31: Dia (Ibrahim) berkata, “Apakah urusanmu yang penting wahai para utusan?”
text.32: Mereka menjawab, “Sesungguhnya kami diutus kepada kaum yang berdosa (kaum Lut),
text.33: agar Kami menimpa mereka dengan batu-batu dari tanah (yang keras),
text.34: yang ditandai dari Tuhanmu untuk (membinasakan) orang-orang yang melampaui batas.”
text.35: Lalu Kami keluarkan orang-orang yang beriman yang berada di dalamnya (negeri kaum Lut) itu.
text.36: Maka Kami tidak mendapati di dalamnya (negeri itu), kecuali sebuah rumah dari orang-orang Muslim (Lut).
text.37: Dan Kami tinggalkan padanya (negeri itu) suatu tanda bagi orang-orang yang takut kepada azab yang pedih.
text.38: Dan pada Musa (terdapat tanda-tanda kekuasaan Allah) ketika Kami mengutusnya kepada Fir‘aun dengan membawa mukjizat yang nyata.
text.39: Tetapi dia (Fir‘aun) bersama bala tentaranya berpaling dan berkata, “Dia adalah seorang pesihir atau orang gila.”
text.40: Maka Kami siksa dia beserta bala tentaranya, lalu Kami lemparkan mereka ke dalam laut, dalam keadaan tercela.
text.41: Dan (juga) pada (kisah kaum) ‘Ad, ketika Kami kirimkan kepada mereka angin yang membinasakan,
text.42: (angin itu) tidak membiarkan suatu apa pun yang dilandanya, bahkan dijadikannya seperti serbuk.
text.43: Dan pada (kisah kaum) Samud, ketika dikatakan kepada mereka, “Bersenang-senanglah kamu sampai waktu yang ditentukan.”
text.44: Lalu mereka berlaku angkuh terhadap perintah Tuhannya, maka mereka disambar petir sedang mereka melihatnya.
text.45: Maka mereka tidak mampu bangun dan juga tidak mendapat pertolongan,
text.46: dan sebelum itu (telah Kami binasakan) kaum Nuh. Sungguh, mereka adalah kaum yang fasik.
text.47: Dan langit Kami bangun dengan kekuasaan (Kami), dan Kami benar-benar meluaskannya.
text.48: Dan bumi Kami hamparkan; maka (Kami) sebaik-baik yang telah menghamparkan.
text.49: Dan segala sesuatu Kami ciptakan berpasang-pasangan agar kamu mengingat (kebesaran Allah).
text.50: Maka segeralah kembali kepada (menaati) Allah. Sungguh, aku seorang pemberi peringatan yang jelas dari Allah untukmu.
text.51: Dan janganlah kamu mengadakan tuhan yang lain selain Allah. Sungguh, aku seorang pemberi peringatan yang jelas dari Allah untukmu.
text.52: Demikianlah setiap kali seorang Rasul yang datang kepada orang-orang yang sebelum mereka, mereka (kaumnya) pasti mengatakan, “Dia itu pesihir atau orang gila.”
text.53: Apakah mereka saling berpesan tentang apa yang dikatakan itu. Sebenarnya mereka adalah kaum yang melampaui batas.
text.54: Maka berpalinglah engkau dari mereka, dan engkau sama sekali tidak tercela.
text.55: Dan tetaplah memberi peringatan, karena sesungguhnya peringatan itu bermanfaat bagi orang-orang mukmin.
text.56: Aku tidak menciptakan jin dan manusia melainkan agar mereka beribadah kepada-Ku.
text.57: Aku tidak menghendaki rezeki sedikit pun dari mereka dan Aku tidak menghendaki agar mereka memberi makan kepada-Ku.
text.58: Sungguh Allah, Dialah Pemberi rezeki Yang Mempunyai Kekuatan lagi Sangat Kokoh.
text.59: Maka sungguh, untuk orang-orang yang zalim ada bagian (azab) seperti bagian teman-teman mereka (dahulu); maka janganlah mereka meminta kepada-Ku untuk menyegerakannya.
text.60: Maka celakalah orang-orang yang kafir pada hari yang telah dijanjikan kepada mereka (hari Kiamat).

text.3: And the ships that sail with ease,
text.5: Indeed, what you are promised is true,
text.6: And indeed, the recompense is sure to occur.
text.8: Indeed, you are of varying opinions,
text.9: Averted therefrom (the Quran and the Messenger) is he who is averted.
text.11: Who are submerged in ignorance and negligence,
text.12: They ask, "When is the Day of Recompense?"
text.13: (It is) the Day when they will be tormented in the Fire.
text.14: (It will be said), "Taste your torment. This is what you used to ask to be hastened."
text.15: Indeed, the righteous will be within gardens (of Paradise) and springs,
text.16: Receiving what their Lord has given them. Indeed, they were before that (in the world) doers of good.
text.17: They used to sleep but little of the night,
text.18: And in the hours before dawn they would ask forgiveness (of Allah).
text.19: And from their wealth was a right for the needy who asks and the deprived.
text.20: And on the earth are signs for those of assured faith,
text.21: And (also) in yourselves. Then do you not see?
text.22: And in the heaven is your provision and what you are promised.
text.23: Then by the Lord of the heaven and earth, indeed, it is truth - just as (sure as) you speak.
text.24: Has there reached you the story of the honored guests of Abraham?
text.25: When they entered upon him and said, "Peace." He said, "Peace." (They were) people unknown to him.
text.26: Then he went to his family unnoticed and brought (them) a fat calf,
text.27: And placed it before them. (But they did not eat.) He said, "Will you not eat?"
text.28: And he felt from them apprehension. They said, "Do not be afraid," and gave him good tidings of a learned son (Isaac).
text.29: Then his wife came forward, crying out, and struck her face, saying, "(I am) an old woman, barren!"
text.30: They said, "Thus has said your Lord. Indeed, He is the Wise, the Knowing."
text.31: He said, "Then what is your business, O messengers?"
text.32: They said, "Indeed, we have been sent to a people who are criminals (the people of Lot),
text.33: To send down upon them stones of clay,
text.34: Marked from your Lord for the transgressors."
text.35: So We brought out those who were believers therein.
text.36: And We found not within it but one house of those who submitted (Muslims - Lot and his family).
text.37: And We left therein a sign for those who fear the painful punishment.
text.38: And in Moses (was a sign) when We sent him to Pharaoh with clear authority.
text.39: But he turned away with his supporters and said, "A magician or a madman."
text.40: So We seized him and his soldiers and threw them into the sea, while he was blameworthy.
text.41: And in (the story of) 'Aad, when We sent upon them the devastating wind.
text.42: It left nothing that it reached but that it made it like disintegrated ruin.
text.43: And in (the story of) Thamud, when it was said to them, "Enjoy yourselves for a time."
text.44: But they defied the command of their Lord, so the thunderbolt seized them while they were looking on.
text.45: And they were unable to rise, nor could they defend themselves.
text.46: And before them (We destroyed) the people of Noah. Indeed, they were a defiantly disobedient people.
text.47: And the heaven We constructed with might, and indeed, We are expanding it.
text.48: And the earth We have spread out, and excellent is the Spreader.
text.49: And of all things We created (in) pairs; perhaps you will remember.
text.50: So flee to Allah. Indeed, I am to you from Him a clear warner.
text.51: And do not make (as equal) with Allah another deity. Indeed, I am to you from Him a clear warner.
text.52: Similarly, there came not to those before them any messenger except that they said, "A magician or a madman."
text.53: Did they advise one another to it? Rather, they are a transgressing people.
text.54: So turn away from them, and you are not to be blamed.
text.55: And remind, for indeed, the reminder benefits the believers.
text.56: And I did not create the jinn and mankind except to worship Me.
text.57: I do not want from them any provision, nor do I want them to feed Me.
text.58: Indeed, Allah is the Provider, the Possessor of strength, the Firm.
text.59: And indeed, for those who have wronged is a portion (of punishment) like the portion of their companions (before them), so let them not ask Me to hasten it.
text.60: So woe to those who have disbelieved from their Day which they are promised.

text.1: Surah adh-dzariyat ini dimulai dengan sumpah dari Allah swt bahwa semua yang diancamkan itu pasti akan berlaku dan bahwa balasan terhadap segala amal pasti akan terbukti. Dalam surah yang sebelumnya, dikisahkan kebinasaan beberapa umat yang terdahulu secara umum dan dalam Surah adh-dzariyat ini diberikan perinciannya. Surah-surah yang pada permulaannya ada sumpah dengan hurufhuruf hijaiah (fawatihus-suwar) biasanya dimaksudkan untuk memperkuat salah satu dari tiga unsur yaitu ketauhidan, kerasulan dan kebangkitan. Dalam surah-surah yang dimaksudkan untuk memperkuat ketauhidan, biasanya digunakan sumpah dengan benda-benda yang tidak bergerak, dan untuk memperkuat keimanan tentang hari kebangkitan digunakan sumpah dengan benda-benda yang bergerak karena kebangkitan itu mengandung pengumpulan dan pemisahan yang lebih pantas dikaitkan dengan benda-benda yang bergerak. Orang Arab sangat takut akan sumpah palsu karena akibat yang sangat buruk dan terkutuk. Oleh karena itu, setiap sumpah yang serius oleh mereka sangat diperhatikan, terlebih jika yang bersumpah itu adalah Allah swt. Dalam ayat-ayat ini Allah bersumpah, "Demi angin kencang yang menerbangkan debu dengan tiupannya yang sangat kuat dan dahsyat. Dan dengan awan yang gumpalannya mengandung banyak air hujan. Dan kapal-kapal yang berlayar hilir-mudik di lautan dengan mudah. Dan dengan para malaikat yang membagi-bagi segala urusan yang dipikulkan kepada mereka seperti mengatur perjalanan planet dan bintang-bintang, soal menurunkan air hujan, membagi rezeki, dan sebagainya." Ayat di atas mengajak kita untuk berpikir tentang angin. Angin adalah massa udara yang bergerak dari tempat yang bertekanan tinggi ke arah yang bertekanan lebih rendah. Penyebab adanya perbedaan tekanan ini adalah perbedaan suhu. Pada keadaan volume yang tetap, kenaikan suhu udara akan menaikkan tekanannya. Tetapi pada kenyataannya di alam kenaikan suhu udara pada suatu tempat akan menyebabkan pemuaian volume udara dan pengaliran udara ke atas, sehingga kerapatan udara di tempat itu akan berkurang dan akan diisi oleh massa udara dari tempat lain yang lebih dingin. Jadi pada dasarnya pergerakan udara ini dikendalikan oleh energi yang ditimbulkan oleh perbedaan suhu di tempat-tempat berlainan di permukaan bumi. Dengan pergerakannya, angin juga berperan sebagai radiator penyeimbang suhu udara. Tanpa adanya angin suhu di daerah gurun akan jauh lebih panas daripada yang didapati sekarang, demikian pula di daerah dingin akan sangat membekukan. Energi pergerakan angin yang memadai dapat memberikan banyak manfaat kepada manusia, seperti untuk pelayaran, memutar kincir untuk pembangkit energi. Di luar kendali manusia angin berperan penting dalam penyerbukan bunga-bunga menjadi buah dan menerbangkan biji-bijian serta spora untuk penyebaran tumbuhan. Fenomena lain yang terjadi adalah terciptanya gelombang di lautan. Pergerakan udara dapat pula terjadi dengan energi yang demikian besar sehingga menimbulkan bencana dan kerugian misalnya dalam bentuk badai dan topan. Dengan angin Allah bersumpah pada ayat berikutnya (adh-dzariyat/51 ayat 4): Dan yang membagi-bagi urusan. Dengan adanya angin, demikian banyak peristiwa-peristiwa yang terjadi yang diakibatkan hembusannya.

text.7: Dalam ayat ini Allah bersumpah: Demi langit yang mempunyai garis edar (orbit) tempat beredarnya bintang-bintang dan planetplanet. Menurut Quraish Shihab, kata al-hubuk dapat berarti yang indah dan baik atau yang teratur. Dapat pula dipahami sebagai bentuk jamak dari habikah atau hibak, yakni jalan, seperti jalan-jalan yang terlihat di atas air apabila ditimpa hembusan angin. Dalam teori fisika relativitas umum, dikenal mengenai mekanisme pemendekan jarak yang sangat jauh menjadi hanya beberapa meter saja. Einstein menyebutnya sebagai jembatan (bridge) dan saat ini para ilmuwan menyebutnya sebagai wormhole (lubang cacing). Wormhole ini merupakan jalan pintas yang menghubungkan dua tempat di jagad raya ini. Sebagai gambaran, kita ingin bepergian ke suatu galaksi yang letaknya 100 juta tahun cahaya dari bumi (jika 1 tahun cahaya = 9,46 x 1012 km, maka galaksi tersebut jaraknya dari bumi sekitar 9,46x1018 km, atau 9,46 juta-juta-juta km!). Tidak terbayangkan kapan kita sampai ke galaksi tersebut. Andaikata ada pesawat ulang-alik yang memiliki kecepatan mendekati kecepatan cahaya saja kita memerlukan waktu 100 juta tahun! Namun apabila kita menggunakan jalan pintas 'wormhole, kita akan sampai di galaksi hari ini. Perlu dicatat bahwa ini merupakan konsekuensi dari pemendekan jarak yang terjadi dalam wormhole. Dengan demikian bisa jadi, al-hubuk berupa sebuah jalan seperti yang digambarkan oleh para ahli fisika, wormhole, sebuah jalan 'khusus yang diberikan Allah kepada para Malaikat dan hambahambaNya yang terpilih. Perjalanan Rasulullah dalam peristiwa Isra' Mi'raj, boleh jadi melewati mekanisme pemendekan jarak sehingga jarak yang demikian jauhnya ditempuh Rasulullah hanya dalam bilangan jam.

text.22: Ayat ini menjelaskan bahwa di langit terdapat sebab-sebab rezeki bagi manusia seperti turunnya hujan yang menyebabkan datangnya kesuburan tanah pertanian dan perkebunan yang menghasilkan berbagai hasil bumi dan buah-buahan sebagai rezeki bagi manusia dan ternak piaraannya, dan terdapat pula apa yang dijanjikan Allah untuk manusia yaitu takdir penetapan Allah terhadap manusia itu masing-masing yang semuanya ditulis di Lauh Mahfudz. Sebab-sebab rezeki di langit yang berlaku bagi semua makhluk hidup dan telah umum diketahui paling tidak ada tiga yaitu, air dalam bentuk hujan, angin dan cahaya matahari. Air menjadi sebab rezeki. Melalui air hujan yang jatuh ke atas tanah dan memberikan kelembaban tanah sehingga memungkinkan ditumbuhi tanaman yang bermanfaat bagi manusia dalam bentuk bahan pangan, sandang dan perumahan Angin oleh manusia bisa dimanfaatkan energinya bagi pelayaran dan menggerakkan kincir sumber energi, atau karena menyebabkan terjadinya penyerbukan tanaman sehingga hasil pembuahannya bisa dimakan manusia (lihat adh-dzariyat/51 ayat 1s/d 3). Sedangkan cahaya matahari merupakan sumber utama energi di permukaan bumi yang bisa diperoleh langsung melalui kehangatannya atau secara tidak langsung melalui pertumbuhan tanaman (fotosintesa) pergerakan angin dan siklus hidrologi (lihat: adh-dzariyat/51 ayat 1s/d 3). Bahkan energi minyak bumi yang saat ini merupakan sumber energi yang paling banyak dipakai, berasal dari energi cahaya matahari yang ditangkap oleh organisma laut (plankton), untuk kemudian terakumulasi sebagai endapan yang kemudian berubah menjadi minyak bumi.

Kata 'langit banyak digunakan dalam berbagai ayat Al-Qur'an. Kata ini, dalam beberapa ayat mempunyai arti alam semesta. Demikian pula halnya pada ayat di atas. Alam semesta bukanlah sesuatu yang statis. Alam semesta adalah sesuatu yang dinamis, selalu berubah, dan meluas. Hal ini diungkapkan setelah ilmu astronomi mengalami kemajuan yang sangat pesat. Keadaan demikian ini ternyata sudah disebutkan dalam Al-Qur'an 14 abad yang lalu, ketika ilmu astronomi masih sangat primitif. Sampai dengan permulaan abad ke-20, alam semesta hanya diketahui sebagai sesuatu yang tercipta pada suatu saat yang tidak dapat diketahui masanya, dan mempunyai bentuk seperti apa yang dilihat saat ini. Penelitian, observasi dan perhitungan-perhitungan dengan menggunakan teknologi modern yang tersedia, mengungkapkan bahwa alam semesta memiliki permulaan, dan sampai saat ini secara teratur terus meluas. Alam semesta adalah kosmos, yaitu ruang angkasa serta semua benda langit yang terdapat di dalamnya, termasuk semua galaksi (tata bintang), baik yang sudah diketahui maupun belum diketahui manusia. Alam semesta, atau alam raya, tidak dapat dibayangkan luasnya. Para ilmuwan mengukur jarak di alam semesta dengan ukuran tahun cahaya. Satu tahun cahaya sama dengan 9,46 triliun km. Bagian alam semesta paling jauh yang sudah "diketahui" manusia adalah pada jarak 15 milyar tahun cahaya. Pada jarak itu ditemukan banyak gugus super galaksi yang jumlahnya tak terhitung. Bintang yang paling dekat dengan matahari berjarak sekitar 4,3 tahun cahaya dari bumi. Matahari dan semua bintang yang dapat kita lihat dengan mata telanjang terdapat dalam gugus galaksi tatasurya, atau dinamakan gugus bimasakti. Di seluruh alam raya ini, terdapat bermiliar galaksi yang sedang bergerak saling menjauh dengan cepat. Galaksi diperkirakan memenuhi ruang angkasa sampai jarak 10.000 juta tahun cahaya dari bumi. Meluasnya alam terus berlangsung sepanjang masa. Hal ini sesuai dengan teori ekspansi yang menyebutkan bahwa nebulae, calon bintang, menjauh dari galaksi bimasakti dengan kecepatan yang berbeda-beda. Bahkan, benda-benda langit dalam satu galaksi pun sedang saling menjauh satu sama lain. Para peneliti mulai melakukan penelitian mengenai pergerakan benda-benda langit pada tahun 1920-an. Diyakini bahwa pada tahun 1920-an merupakan momentum penting dalam perkembangan astronomi modern. Pada tahun 1922, ahli fisika Rusia, Alexander Friedman, menghasilkan perhitungan yang menunjukkan bahwa struktur alam semesta tidaklah statis. Ia menyebutkan bahwa penyebab sekecil apa pun cukup untuk menyebabkan struktur alam semesta mengembang atau mengerut menurut Teori Relativitas Einstein. George Lemaitre, seorang ahli kosmologi dari Belgia, adalah orang pertama yang menyadari arti perhitungan Friedman. Berdasarkan perhitungan ini, Lemaitre, menyatakan bahwa alam semesta mempunyai permulaan dan alam mengembang sebagai akibat dari sesuatu yang telah memicunya. Pemikiran teoritis kedua ilmuwan ini tidak menarik banyak perhatian. Pemikiran ini barangkali akan terabaikan, jika tidak ditemukan bukti pengamatan baru yang mengguncangkan dunia ilmiah pada tahun 1929. Pada tahun itu, ahli astronomi Amerika, Edwin Hubble, membuat penemuan paling penting dalam sejarah astronomi. Ketika mengamati sejumlah bintang melalui teleskop raksasanya, dia menemukan bahwa cahaya bintang-bintang itu bergeser ke arah ujung merah spektrum. Pergeseran itu berkaitan langsung dengan perubahan jarak bintang-bintang dari bumi. Pengamatannya menemukan bahwa suatu galaksi yang berjarak satu juta tahun cahaya dari bumi sedang bergerak menjauh pada kecepatan 168 km per tahun. Alam semesta, dimana benda-benda langitnya secara teratur bergerak saling menjauhi, mengindikasikan bahwa alam semesta itu sendiri juga sedang mengembang. Pengamatan pada tahun-tahun berikutnya mengungkapkan dan mengkonfirmasi dugaan tersebut. Bintang-bintang tidak hanya menjauh dari bumi; mereka juga menjauhi satu sama lain. Satusatunya kesimpulan yang dapat diturunkan dari temuan ini adalah bahwa alam semesta sedang "mengembang". Suatu konfirmasi kepada pernyataan yang ada di dalam Al-Qur'an, jauh sebelum hal itu diketahui oleh umat manusia. Penemuan ini mengguncangkan landasan model alam semesta yang diyakini pada saat itu. Temuannya ini diakui dunia. Namun perhitungannya dianggap salah, dan direvisi kemudian. Menurut sementara ilmuwan, suatu saat nanti, diperkirakan alam raya ini tidak lagi berkembang. Ia akan mengkerut dan kembali menyatu seperti semula. Kalau peristiwa ledakan dahsyat yang menjadi tanda terbentuknya aneka planet, dan berpisahnya langit dan bumi, dinamai Big Bang; maka penyusutan dan penyatuan alam raya dinamai Big Crunch.
text.48: Ayat ini menerangkan bahwa Allah swt membentangkan bumi berupa hamparan dengan maksud untuk dihuni oleh manusia dan hewan. Dijadikan-Nya bumi penuh rezeki dan bahan pangan, baik berupa binatangnya, tumbuh-tumbuhan maupun yang lain-lain yang terpelihara keabadiannya sampai hari Kiamat. Demikian juga Allah swt menjadikan dalam perut bumi barang-barang tambang yang tampak dan yang tidak tampak yang semuanya diperuntukkan bagi manusia. Dengan isi bumi itu manusia dapat mendirikan bangunanbangunan, membuat perhiasan dari emas, perak, dan batu-batu permata lainnya. Kemudian setelah itu manusia membuat alat perang, kapal laut, pesawat terbang dari bahan besi dan dari barang tambang lainnya. Pada akhir ayat ini Allah menyatakan kekuasaan dan keindahan ciptaan-Nya dengan mengatakan, "Betapa bagusnya apa yang telah Kami jadikan, dan betapa indahnya apa yang telah Kami ciptakan."
text.49: Selanjutnya Allah swt menerangkan bahwa Dia menciptakan segala macam kejadian dalam bentuk yang berlainan dan dengan sifat yang bertentangan. Yaitu setiap sesuatu itu merupakan lawan atau pasangan bagi yang lain. Dijadikan-Nya kebahagiaan dan kesengsaraan, petunjuk dan kesesatan, malam dan siang, langit dan bumi, hitam dan putih, lautan dan daratan, gelap dan terang, hidup dan mati, surga dan neraka, dan sebagainya. Semuanya itu dimaksudkan agar manusia ingat dan sadar serta mengambil pelajaran dari semuanya, sedangkan Allah Maha Esa tidak memerlukan pasangan. Dengan demikian hanya Allah yang tidak membutuhkan yang lain. Sehingga mengetahui bahwa Allah-lah Tuhan yang Maha Esa yang berhak disembah dan tak ada sekutu bagi-Nya. Dia-lah yang kuasa menjadikan segala sesuatu dan Dia pulalah yang kuasa untuk memusnahkannya, Dialah yang juga kuasa menciptakan segala sesuatu berpasang-pasang, bermacam-macam jenis dan bentuk, sedangkan mahluk-Nya tidak berdaya dan harus menyadari hal itu. Penjelasan mengenai Allah menciptakan segala sesuatunya berpasang-pasangan menurut kajian ilmiah dapat dilihat pada penjelasan Surah asy-Syura/42: 11. (
text.50: Oleh sebab itu, hendaklah manusia meminta perlindungan kepada Allah dan berpegang kepada-Nya dalam segala urusan dan masalahnya dengan menaati segala perintah-Nya dan bekerja untuk tujuan taat kepada-Nya. Allah swt selanjutnya akan menyiksa orangorang yang tidak menaati perintah-Nya. Pada akhir ayat ini Allah memerintahkan rasul-Nya supaya menegaskan bahwa ia sesungguhnya mendapat amanat dari Allah swt untuk menyampaikan kepada manusia bahwa Allah swt akan membalas dengan siksaan kepada mereka atas segala pelanggaran pelanggaran terhadap perintah-Nya, sebagaimana Allah swt menurunkan siksa-Nya kepada umat-umat yang terdahulu.

Kemudian Allah swt dalam ayat ini melarang manusia menjadikan sesuatu sembahan di samping-Nya. Karena segala sesuatu selain Allah tidak patut disembah. Pada akhir ayat ini Allah swt memerintahkan kepada rasul-Nya supaya menegaskan bahwa ia sesungguhnya pemberi peringatan yang sebenarnya dari Allah, untuk menyampaikan peringatan akan adanya siksaan Allah bagi siapa saja yang menjadikan suatu makhluk sebagai tujuan ibadat dan disembah. Dalam ayat yang sama artinya Allah swt berfirman: 

Barang siapa mengharap pertemuan dengan Tuhannya maka hendaklah dia mengerjakan kebajikan dan janganlah dia mempersekutukan dengan sesuatu pun dalam beribadah kepada Tuhannya." (al-Kahf/18: 110)
text.52: Dalam ayat ini Allah menerangkan bahwa kaum Quraisy mendustakan Muhammad saw, dengan menuduh bahwa Muhammad saw itu tukang sihir atau orang gila. Demikian juga halnya umatumat terdahulu telah mendustakan rasul mereka. Mereka telah mengatakan seperti kata-kata yang dilontarkan oleh kaum kafir Mekah itu. Hal itu bukanlah suatu hal yang baru dalam kisah umat manusia. Semua rasul itu telah didustakan dan disakiti, akan tetapi rasul-rasul tersebut bersabar hingga datangnya pertolongan Allah. Ayat ini sebagai penghibur hati Rasulullah atas segala penderitaan yang dialaminya akibat penolakan kafir Mekah. Mereka telah menjadi angkuh dengan hal-hal kebendaan yang merupakan nikmat yang mengagungkan mereka. Mereka teperdaya oleh penundaan azab Tuhan kepada mereka. Maka segala peringatan dan nasihat tidak bermanfaat bagi mereka.
text.53: Dalam ayat ini Allah mencela orang-orang kafir itu dengan mengatakan, "Apakah orang-orang yang kafir terdahulu itu telah berpesan kepada yang kemudian dari mereka untuk mendustakan Muhammad saw dan mereka datang kemudian itu betul-betul menerima dan mengikuti saran tersebut?" Mereka sesungguhnya adalah kaum yang durhaka yang melampaui batas dalam pelanggaran-pelanggaran ketentuan agama dan akal. Kedurhakaan mereka itulah yang merupakan tali pengikat antara orang-orang yang terdahulu dengan orang-orang kemudian yang seolah-olah memanifestasikan adanya pesan tersebut.
text.54: Muhammad saw diperintahkan Allah supaya berpaling dari mereka, dan Allah menerangkan bahwa ia tidak tercela karena Dia tidak membebani Rasulullah untuk mengislamkan kaum kafir Mekah. Tugasnya hanyalah melakukan dakwah dan ini telah dilakukannya.
text.55: Ayat ini memerintahkan kepada Muhammad saw agar tetap memberikan peringatan dan nasihat, karena peringatan dan nasihat itu akan bermanfaat bagi orang yang hatinya siap menerima petunjuk. Diriwayatkan oleh Ibnu Jarir, Ibnu Abi hatim, dan al-Baihaqi bahwa 'Ali bin Abi thalib berkata, "Setelah diturunkan ayat 54 tersebut yaitu tatkala Allah memerintahkan kepada Nabi Muhammad saw untuk memalingkan diri, maka setiap orang menyangka akan datang malapetaka yang akan menimpa. Maka turunlah ayat 55 ini, dan legalah perasaan dan lapanglah dada kami.
text.56:
Ayat ini menegaskan bahwa Allah tidaklah menjadikan jin dan manusia melainkan untuk mengenal-Nya dan supaya menyembah-Nya. Dalam kaitan ini Allah swt berfirman: 

Padahal mereka hanya disuruh menyembah Tuhan Yang MahaEsa; tidak ada tuhan selain Dia. Mahasuci Dia dari apa yang mereka persekutukan. (at-Taubah/9: 31) 

Pendapat tersebut sama dengan pendapat az-Zajjaj, tetapi ahli tafsir yang lain berpendapat bahwa maksud ayat tersebut ialah bahwa Allah tidak menjadikan jin dan manusia kecuali untuk tunduk kepada-Nya dan untuk merendahkan diri. Maka setiap makhluk, baik jin atau manusia wajib tunduk kepada peraturan Tuhan, merendahkan diri terhadap kehendak-Nya. Menerima apa yang Dia takdirkan, mereka dijadikan atas kehendak-Nya dan diberi rezeki sesuai dengan apa yang telah Dia tentukan. Tak seorang pun yang dapat memberikan manfaat atau mendatangkan mudarat karena kesemuanya adalah dengan kehendak Allah. Ayat tersebut menguatkan perintah mengingat Allah swt dan memerintahkan manusia supaya melakukan ibadah kepada Allah swt.
text.57:
Pada ayat ini Allah menerangkan bahwa sesungguhnya Dia tidak akan minta bantuan mereka untuk sesuatu kemanfaatan atau kemudaratan dan tidak pula menghendaki rezeki dan memberikan makan seperti apa yang dikerjakan oleh para majikan terhadap buruhnya, karena Allah tidak perlu kepada mereka, bahkan merekalah yang memerlukan-Nya dalam segala urusan mereka, Allah adalah pencipta mereka dan pemberi rezeki mereka. Dialah yang mempunyai kekuasaan, kemampuan dan kekuatan yang tak terhingga. Akan tetapi kebanyakan manusia tidak mengerti. Abu Hurairah meriwayatkan dan berkata: 

Rasulullah bersabda: "Allah berfirman:"Wahai anak Adam, luangkanlah waktu untuk beribadat kepada-Ku niscaya Aku penuhi dadamu dengan kekayaan dan Ku-tutupi kefakiranmu, dan jika engkau tidak berbuat (menyediakan waktu untuk beribadat kepadaKu) niscaya akan Ku-penuhi dadamu dengan kesibukan (keruwetan) dan tak akan Ku-tutupi keperluanmu (kefakiran)." (Riwayat Ahmad dari Abu Hurairah)

Allah swt menegaskan bahwa ancaman-Nya itu pasti terjadi, dan terjadinya pada hari Kiamat. Allah swt menyatakan dalam ayat ini bahwa bagi siapa yang menganiaya dirinya dengan menyibukkan diri pada segala sesuatu di luar ibadat kepada Allah swt, mempersekutukan Allah swt dan mendustakan para Rasul-Nya, mereka itu akan mendapat bagian siksa seperti bagian yang diperoleh oleh umat-umat terdahulu yang telah mendustakan para rasul mereka. Janganlah mereka memohon supaya Allah swt menyegerakan siksaan-Nya karena Allah swt tidak khawatir kehilangan kesempatan. Ini merupakan jawaban terhadap mereka yang digambarkan oleh Allah dalam ayat: 

Maka buktikanlah ancamanmu kepada kami, jika kamu benar!" (alA'raf/7: 70) 

Dalam ayat yang sama artinya dengan ayat ini Allah berfirman: 

Ketetapan Allah pasti datang, maka janganlah kamu meminta agar dipercepat (datang)nya. (an-Nahl/16: 1)

text.1: This Surah Adh-Dhariyat begins with an oath from Allah SWT that everything threatened will surely come to pass and that the recompense for all deeds will certainly be proven. In the previous surah, the destruction of several past peoples was narrated in general terms, and in Surah Adh-Dhariyat, the details are provided. Surahs that begin with oaths using the letters of the alphabet (fawatihus-suwar) are usually intended to reinforce one of three elements: monotheism, prophethood, and resurrection. In surahs intended to strengthen monotheism, oaths are usually made with inanimate objects, and to strengthen faith in the Day of Resurrection, oaths are made with moving objects because the resurrection involves gathering and separation, which are more appropriately associated with moving objects. The Arabs were very afraid of false oaths because of the very bad and cursed consequences. Therefore, every serious oath by them was given great attention, especially if the one swearing was Allah SWT. In these verses, Allah swears, "By the winnowing winds scattering [dust] and debris. And the clouds carrying a load [of water]. And the ships running with ease. And the distributors [angels] dividing [matters] by command." The verse above invites us to think about the wind. Wind is a mass of air moving from a place of high pressure to a place of lower pressure. The cause of this pressure difference is temperature difference. In a fixed volume, an increase in air temperature will increase its pressure. But in reality, in nature, an increase in air temperature in one place will cause the air volume to expand and the air to flow upwards, so that the air density in that place will decrease and will be filled by air masses from other colder places. So basically, this air movement is controlled by the energy generated by temperature differences in different places on the earth's surface. With its movement, the wind also acts as a radiator balancing air temperature. Without wind, the temperature in desert areas would be much hotter than it is now, and in cold areas it would be very freezing. Adequate wind movement energy can provide many benefits to humans, such as for sailing, turning windmills for energy generation. Outside of human control, wind plays an important role in the pollination of flowers into fruits and in flying seeds and spores for plant dispersal. Another phenomenon that occurs is the creation of waves in the ocean. Air movement can also occur with such great energy that it causes disasters and losses, for example in the form of storms and typhoons. With the wind, Allah swears in the next verse (Adh-Dhariyat/51 verse 4): And those who distribute [commands]. With the wind, so many events occur as a result of its blowing.

text.7: In this verse, Allah swears: By the sky containing pathways (orbits) where stars and planets revolve. According to Quraish Shihab, the word *al-hubuk* can mean that which is beautiful and good, or that which is orderly. It can also be understood as the plural form of *habikah* or *hibak*, which means path, like the paths seen on water when struck by a gust of wind. In the theory of general relativity in physics, there is a mechanism known as the shortening of very long distances to just a few meters. Einstein called it a bridge, and scientists today call it a wormhole. This wormhole is a shortcut connecting two places in the universe. As an illustration, let's say we want to travel to a galaxy that is 100 million light-years away from Earth (if 1 light-year = 9.46 x 1012 km, then the galaxy is about 9.46 x 1018 km, or 9.46 million-million-million km away from Earth!). It is unimaginable when we would arrive at that galaxy. Even if there were a space shuttle that had a speed approaching the speed of light, it would take us 100 million years! But if we use the 'wormhole' shortcut, we will arrive at the galaxy today. It should be noted that this is a consequence of the shortening of distance that occurs within a wormhole. Thus, it could be that *al-hubuk* is a path as described by physicists, a wormhole, a 'special' path given by Allah to the Angels and His chosen servants. The Prophet's journey during the *Isra' Mi'raj* event may have passed through a distance-shortening mechanism, so that the distance, which was so far, was traveled by the Prophet in just a matter of hours.

text.13: This verse reveals that the Day of Recompense is the day when the disbelievers are punished with a most severe torment in the fire of Hell. Indeed, if polytheists have slaves who work as daily laborers, they will certainly inspect their work before they are given wages. They examine, ask, and scrutinize the results of their laborers' work. Do they not consider the devotion of all mankind to Allah, who has bestowed all kinds of blessings upon them, from the creation of the heavens and the earth and all that is in them, to the fulfillment of all human needs such as clothing, food, housing, old-age security, and so on? Is it fitting that Allah should allow them to live extravagantly, even though Allah did not create mankind in vain, but will surely establish the Day of Resurrection and the Day of Recompense? Because they are immersed in the currents of ignorance and negligence, these very reasonable and obvious things are allowed to pass by without seriousness and attention, and only then do they realize it when they are tormented in the fire of Hell.
text.14: Besides the excruciating torment, they also suffer spiritual torment when the angels say, "Taste this torment which you used to ask to be hastened while you were in the world."
text.15: This verse explains that indeed, those who are pious, who carry out all of Allah's commands and avoid all His prohibitions, are in gardens of Paradise beneath which flow clear and pure waters, very pleasant, very comfortable, beyond all expectations and images etched in the heart and seen by the eyes; especially because they remain eternally within it, never to leave again, remaining in the pleasure of Allah, the Most Compassionate, the Most Merciful. This reward is related to their deeds when they were in the world, which is that they took all the gifts bestowed upon them by their Lord, because when they were in the world, they always performed good deeds, both towards Allah and towards their fellow human beings, with the sole purpose of attaining His pleasure.
text.16: This verse explains that indeed, those who are pious, who carry out all of Allah's commands and avoid all His prohibitions, are in gardens of Paradise beneath which flow clear and pure waters, exceedingly pleasant, exceedingly comfortable, beyond any expectation or image etched in the heart or seen by the eyes; especially because they remain eternally within it, never to leave again, remaining in the pleasure of Allah, the Most Compassionate, the Most Merciful. This reward is related to their deeds when they were in the world, which is that they accepted all the gifts bestowed upon them by their Lord, because when they were in the world, they always performed good deeds, both towards Allah and towards their fellow human beings, with the sole aim of attaining His pleasure.
text.17: This verse explains the characteristics of the God-fearing, namely, they sleep very little at night because they fill their time with Tahajud prayers. In performing their Tahajud worship, they feel calm and full of longing, and in their supplications to Allah, they deliberately choose a time that is quiet from the disturbances of other creatures, like two newlyweds pouring out their hearts to their beloved, of course choosing a comfortable and safe place and time free from anyone's disturbance. They remember that living together with family and others cannot last forever. When the appointed time (ajal) arrives, they will surely separate, enter the grave, each one alone. Therefore, before the time of separation arrives, they feel a great need to establish a relationship of service and love (mahabbah) with the Almighty God, the only ruler who can fulfill all hopes. In the late hours of the night (at the time of sahur), they ask forgiveness from Allah. The time of sahur is deliberately chosen because most people are sound asleep, the situation is quiet from all busyness, making it easy to establish a relationship with their Lord.

text.19: This verse explains that in addition to performing obligatory and sunnah prayers, they also always spend *fi sabilillah* by giving obligatory *zakat* or charitable donations or voluntary support because they consider that in their wealth there is a right for the poor who ask and the poor who do not ask for a share because they feel ashamed to ask. Ibn Jarir narrates a hadith from Abu Hurairah that the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) once explained who is considered poor, with his saying: "The poor are not those who are not given one or two dates, or one or two mouthfuls of food." He was asked, "(If that is the case) who is called poor?" He replied, "The person who does not have what is needed and whose place is not known so that charity is not given to him. That is the person who is deprived and cannot get a share." (Narrated by Ibn Jarir from Abu Hurairah) In the Qur'an there are three groups of verses that are always side by side, inseparable, namely the command to pray and give *zakat*, the command to obey Allah and His Messenger, and the command to be grateful to Allah and both parents. After Allah explains the characteristics of the pious, then Allah explains that they see with the conscience signs of Allah's power in the cosmos, in the universe that stretches around them, on earth and in the sky, so that they have peace of mind, as a sign of someone who has *ma'rifah* to Allah.
text.20: This verse explains that on this earth there are signs that demonstrate the power of Allah when viewed with the eye of the heart, namely large, beautiful, and magnificent objects such as the sun, the moon, mountains, dense forests, fertile plantations, the vast blue ocean stretching as far as the eye can see filled with various kinds of fish like those seen in an aquarium, and others. All of these show how great and perfect is its Creator, Allah Rabbul 'alamin. Contemplation (Tafakur) about the beauty of nature truly increases the love and conviction of those who are certain of Allah's power.
text.21: This verse alludes to the fact that within humanity itself lie proofs of Allah's power and greatness, such as the differences in abilities, differences in languages, intelligence, and the many varieties of body parts, each with its own specific function.
text.22: This verse explains that in the heavens there are means of sustenance for mankind, such as the descent of rain which causes the fertility of agricultural land and plantations, producing various agricultural products and fruits as sustenance for humans and their livestock. And there is also what Allah has promised for mankind, namely Allah's decree of determination for each individual, all of which is written in Lauh Mahfudz. The means of sustenance in the heavens that apply to all living creatures and are generally known are at least three: water in the form of rain, wind, and sunlight. Water is a cause of sustenance. Through rainwater that falls on the ground and provides soil moisture, it allows plants to grow that are beneficial to humans in the form of food, clothing, and housing. Wind can be used by humans for energy in navigation and to drive windmills as a source of energy, or because it causes plant pollination so that the fruit can be eaten by humans (see adh-dhariyat/51 verses 1-3). Meanwhile, sunlight is the main source of energy on the earth's surface, which can be obtained directly through its warmth or indirectly through plant growth (photosynthesis), wind movement, and the hydrological cycle (see: adh-dhariyat/51 verses 1-3). Even the petroleum energy, which is currently the most widely used energy source, comes from the energy of sunlight captured by marine organisms (plankton), which then accumulates as sediment and then turns into petroleum.
text.23: This verse explains that Allah swears to establish certainty in the hearts of mankind regarding the existence of the Day of Resurrection. Allah swears by the Lord of the heavens and the earth, that indeed the Day of Judgment, the Day of Resurrection, the Day of Recompense, and the distribution of sustenance is certainly true, just as certain as a person is about the words he speaks. Thus, mankind must be certain that they will encounter all that Allah has promised, just as certain as they are when listening to their own words, especially if their words can be recorded on a cassette tape.
text.24: Allah recounts the story of Prophet Ibrahim in the form of a question to draw greater attention to it. Allah asks, "Has there reached you (O Muhammad) the story of the honored guests of Ibrahim?" The angels who met with Prophet Ibrahim were actually on their way to the dwelling place of the people of Prophet Lut near the villages of Sodom and Gomorrah, to deliver news to Prophet Lut that his disobedient people who practiced homosexuality would be destroyed by Allah with a painful punishment. On their journey, they stopped by the house of Prophet Ibrahim to deliver the good news that he would have a learned and righteous son named Isaac from his wife Sarah, even though he was advanced in age and thought himself to be barren. Upon arriving at the house of Prophet Ibrahim, they were greeted by the host with full respect.
text.25: This verse reveals that when the guest angels entered the place of Prophet Ibrahim and conveyed the greeting of peace (salam), and Prophet Ibrahim responded with peace (salam) as well, he showed an inquiring attitude because he did not yet know them. These honored guests were entering the house of Prophet Ibrahim for the first time. Therefore, he showed a desire to get to know them first. But he did not wait for the opportunity to become acquainted; instead, he secretly went into the kitchen to prepare a meal.
text.26: This verse explains that Prophet Ibrahim secretly went to his family, namely Sarah, then slaughtered a fat calf, and after it was roasted, he personally brought the dish before his guests, saying respectfully, and then invited them to eat.
text.27: This verse explains that Prophet Ibrahim secretly went to his family, namely Sarah, then slaughtered a fat calf, and after it was roasted, he personally brought the dish before his guests, saying respectfully, and then invited them to eat.
text.28:
This verse reveals that Prophet Ibrahim's guests did not touch the food because they were not human beings, but angels who do not eat or drink. So Prophet Ibrahim felt afraid of them because, according to custom, if a guest refuses to eat the food offered to them, it means there is a hidden danger behind it, or something unexpected will happen. In another verse with the same meaning, Allah says:

"But when he saw that their hands did not reach for it, he mistrusted them and felt apprehension of them. They said, "Fear not. Indeed, we have been sent to the people of Lot." (Hud/11:70) After the angels reassured Prophet Ibrahim, they delivered the good news that Ibrahim would have a son named Isaac, and after Isaac, there would be his grandson, Prophet Jacob, as explained in another verse.
text.29: This verse reveals that his wife Sarah, after hearing the news, came with a loud shriek and slapped her own face, saying, how could I possibly give birth to a child, when I am an old and barren woman?
text.30: This verse reveals the angel's response to Sarah's doubt, that she need not be surprised; such is the decree of Allah, the All-Wise, the All-Knowing.
text.31:
Prophet Ibrahim asked the angels after hosting them with food, but they did not touch the food that was served, causing Prophet Ibrahim's heart to pound. Then he asked, "Is there a word from Allah in this matter, O messengers?" In another verse of Allah, it is described as follows:

"And when fear had left Abraham and the good tidings had reached him, he began to argue with Us concerning the people of Lot. Indeed, Abraham was forbearing, compassionate and ever returning [to Allah]. O Abraham, give this up. Indeed, the command of your Lord has come, and they will be overtaken by a punishment that cannot be repelled." (Hud/11: 74 - 76)
text.32: The angels answered that they were indeed sent to the people of Lot, carrying a very painful punishment because of their heinous sin, which was engaging in homosexuality. The angels would pelt the people of Lot with stones made from very hard clay that had been burned, and which had been marked from Allah's side with the names of those who would be destroyed, namely those who transgressed in wickedness.
text.33: The angels answered that they were indeed sent to the people of Lot, carrying a very painful punishment due to their heinous sin of engaging in homosexuality. The angels would pelt the people of Lot with stones made from very hard, baked clay, and marked from Allah's side with the names of those who would be destroyed, namely those who transgressed in wickedness.
text.34: The angels answered that they were indeed sent to the people of Lot, carrying a very painful punishment due to their heinous sin of engaging in homosexuality. The angels would pelt the people of Lot with stones made from very hard, baked clay, marked from Allah's side with the names of those who would be destroyed, namely those who transgressed in wickedness.
text.35: In this verse, Allah explains that after the angels went to the people of Lot to bring down punishment, questions arose among them about how to destroy the disobedient people. So, Allah commanded them to first remove the believers from their homeland, so that they would be spared from the punishment. The angels only found one house, namely the house of Prophet Lot, with its Muslim inhabitants numbering only about thirteen people. Those who were saved in this verse are referred to as Muslims who surrendered themselves and diligently carried out Allah's commands and avoided His prohibitions. In these two verses, it is explained that among the people of Lot lived believers (Mukminin) and Muslims. According to Muhammad Ali ash-Shabuni, they are called Mukminin (verse 35) because they believe with their hearts, and they are called Muslims (verse 36) because they practice the teachings of Allah with their bodies through obedience. This is in line with the hadith of al-Bukhari and Muslim, when the Messenger of Allah (saw) was asked about Islam and Iman: "What is Islam?" He replied, "That you testify that there is no god but Allah and that Muhammad is the Messenger of Allah, establish prayer (the five daily prayers), give zakat, fast in the month of Ramadan, and perform Hajj to the House of Allah." And "What is Iman?" He replied, "That you believe in Allah, His angels, His books, His messengers, the Last Day, and in good and bad destiny from Allah." (Narrated by al-Bukhari and Muslim). It needs to be explained here that if the word Islam is mentioned alone, then it includes the meaning of Iman. Likewise, if the word Iman is mentioned alone, it includes the word Islam. But if both are mentioned together, then the two are different from each other, each having its own meaning, Iman being different from Islam.

text.37: In this verse, Allah SWT explains that the destruction of the people of Lot should be taken as a warning for those who fear Allah, and the traces of that event can be seen in the signs, namely the piles of stones where the punishment was sent, which have sunk (into the earth) and formed a lake, namely Lake Tiberias (the Dead Sea). This verse contains an indication that if disbelief and wickedness are rampant in a city, then the small number of believers cannot prevent the coming of punishment. And if the majority of its inhabitants consist of pious people, then they can be protected from punishment, even if there are some who are disobedient to God.
text.38: In this verse, Allah explains that in the story of Moses there is a lesson for those who think. Namely, when Allah sent Moses to Pharaoh with convincing explanations and reinforced by clear miracles that could be witnessed with the human eye at that time.
text.39:
However, Pharaoh rejected Moses' teachings and rebelled, saying that what Moses brought was nothing but lies. Pharaoh's rejection was done by boasting about his troops, guards, ministers, strength, and power, while saying, "Indeed, Moses is a skilled magician or a madman." Pharaoh's words are expressed in the Qur'an:

He (Pharaoh) said, "Indeed, your messenger who has been sent to you is truly a madman." (ash-Shu'ara'/26:27)

Pharaoh intended for his people to reject Moses' call, so that they would not pay attention to or think about what had been proclaimed. This was because Pharaoh feared losing his influence, the collapse of his power, and feared losing his wealth, prestige, and position.
text.40: This verse explains that Allah SWT is very angry with Pharaoh and his army. They were all thrown and submerged into the sea, receiving reproach for their disbelief and disobedience. This is a sign of the greatness of Allah's power to humiliate those who disbelieve and a sign that they received a bad consequence. It is also a reward for their arrogance and denial of the Creator's command.
text.41: Then in this verse, Allah SWT narrates the story of the destruction of the 'Ad people. The disaster that befell that people should be taken as a lesson for those who think. That is, when Allah SWT sent down a scorching wind that destroyed them so that nothing remained except destruction and annihilation, both humans and animals, as well as buildings. In short, not one of them survived the scorching wind and fiery blast, and moreover, not a single building was left undestroyed, everything became ruins and was utterly destroyed.
text.42: Then in this verse, Allah SWT narrates the story of the destruction of the 'Ad people. The disaster that befell that people should be taken as a lesson for those who think. That is, when Allah SWT sent down a scorching wind that destroyed them so that nothing remained except destruction and annihilation, both humans and animals as well as buildings. In short, not one of them survived the scorching wind and fiery blasts, and no building was left un-destroyed, everything became rubble and was completely destroyed.
text.43:
In this verse, Allah swt explains the story of the people of Thamud, which contains advice for those who are aware and those who contemplate the signs of the reality of God's existence. That is, when Prophet Saleh said to them to enjoy themselves in their homes until the punishment of God came. Another verse with the same meaning, Allah says: "Enjoy yourselves in your homes for three days. That is a promise not to be denied." (Hud/11: 65)

After the promised three days, Allah destroyed them with a punishment in the form of lightning, as Allah says in the following:

"And as for Thamud, We guided them, but they preferred blindness (error) over guidance, so they were struck by the thunderbolt of humiliating punishment for what they used to earn." (Fussilat/41: 17) Then after that, a punishment was sent down upon them that they could not reject. However, they said that it was all just a lie, and they even acted arrogantly without worrying about the consequences of God's threat. So, Allah swt then sent down lightning from the sky, striking them and wiping them all out; they saw and experienced this event. This disaster was a reward for their sins and for the ignorance they committed.
text.44:
In this verse, Allah SWT explains the story of the people of Thamud, which contains advice for those who are aware and those who contemplate the signs of the reality of God's existence. That is, when Prophet Saleh said to them to enjoy themselves in their homes until the punishment of God came. Another verse with the same meaning, Allah says: "Enjoy yourselves in your homes for three days. That is a promise not to be denied." (Hud/11: 65)

After the promised three days had passed, Allah destroyed them with a punishment in the form of lightning, as Allah says in the following:

"And as for Thamud, We guided them, but they preferred blindness (error) over guidance, so the thunderbolt of humiliating punishment seized them for what they used to earn." (Fussilat/41: 17) Then after that, a punishment was sent down upon them that they could not reject. However, they said that all of that was just a false report, and they even acted arrogantly without worrying about the consequences of God's threat. Then Allah SWT sent down lightning from the sky, striking them and wiping them all out; they saw and experienced that event. That disaster was a recompense for their sins and for the ignorance they committed.
text.45: In this verse, Allah swt explains that they cannot escape from that calamity, nor will they find a way out or help from anyone. Furthermore, they will not be able to help one another to avoid the punishment of God at that time.
text.46: This verse explains that Allah had previously destroyed the people of Noah with a storm or hurricane that struck them because of their wickedness, evil, and violations of what Allah SWT had forbidden (haram).
text.47: This verse explains that Allah SWT has created the heavens with a beautiful form that demonstrates the magnificence of His power, such as raising the heavens above with His power, making them like a high and sturdy roof. And Allah SWT is capable of all that; He never tires or weakens, nor does He ever feel weary. Indirectly, this verse refutes the words of the Jews who say that Allah SWT created the heavens and the earth in 6 (six) days, but on the seventh day, Allah rested and lay on His 'Arsy because He was tired. The word 'heaven' is widely used in various verses of the Qur'an. In some verses, this word means the universe. The same is true of the verse above. The universe is not something static. The universe is something dynamic, always changing, and expanding. This was revealed after astronomy experienced very rapid progress. This situation was already mentioned in the Qur'an 14 centuries ago, when astronomy was still very primitive. Until the beginning of the 20th century, the universe was only known as something created at a time that could not be known, and had a form as seen today. Research, observations, and calculations using available modern technology reveal that the universe has a beginning, and until now it is regularly expanding. The universe is the cosmos, namely outer space and all the celestial bodies contained within it, including all galaxies (star systems), both known and unknown to humans. The universe, or the cosmos, is unimaginably vast. Scientists measure distances in the universe in light-years. One light-year is equal to 9.46 trillion km. The farthest part of the universe that humans have "known" is at a distance of 15 billion light-years. At that distance, many superclusters of galaxies are found in countless numbers. The star closest to the sun is about 4.3 light-years from Earth. The sun and all the stars that we can see with the naked eye are in the solar system galaxy cluster, or called the Milky Way cluster. Throughout this universe, there are billions of galaxies that are moving away from each other rapidly. Galaxies are estimated to fill outer space to a distance of 10,000 million light-years from Earth. If in one second, light travels a distance of ± 200,000 km, how vast is outer space actually? Allah expands the universe so vastly since it was created. The expansion of the universe continues throughout time. This is in accordance with the expansion theory which states that nebulae, candidate stars, move away from the Milky Way galaxy at different speeds. In fact, celestial bodies within one galaxy are also moving away from each other. Researchers began conducting research on the movement of celestial bodies in the 1920s. It is believed that the 1920s were an important momentum in the development of modern astronomy. In 1922, Russian physicist Alexander Friedman produced calculations showing that the structure of the universe was not static. He mentioned that the slightest cause was enough to cause the structure of the universe to expand or contract according to Einstein's Theory of Relativity. George Lemaitre, a cosmologist from Belgium, was the first to realize the meaning of Friedman's calculations. Based on these calculations, Lemaitre stated that the universe has a beginning and the universe expands as a result of something that triggered it. The theoretical thinking of these two scientists did not attract much attention. This thinking would probably have been ignored if a new observational evidence that shook the scientific world had not been found in 1929. In that year, American astronomer Edwin Hubble made the most important discovery in the history of astronomy. When observing a number of stars through his giant telescope, he found that the light of the stars shifted towards the red end of the spectrum. This shift is directly related to the change in the distance of the stars from Earth. His observations found that a galaxy one million light-years from Earth is moving away at a speed of 168 km per year. The universe, where celestial bodies are regularly moving away from each other, indicates that the universe itself is also expanding. Observations in subsequent years revealed and confirmed this assumption. Stars are not only moving away from Earth; they are also moving away from each other. The only conclusion that can be drawn from this finding is that the universe is "expanding". A confirmation to the statement in the Qur'an, long before it was known by mankind. This discovery shook the foundations of the model of the universe that was believed at that time. His findings are recognized by the world. However, his calculations were considered wrong, and were later revised. According to some scientists, it is estimated that one day, the universe will no longer expand. It will shrink and reunite as before. If the massive explosion that marked the formation of various planets, and the separation of the heavens and the earth, is called the Big Bang; then the shrinking and unification of the universe is called the Big Crunch.
text.48: This verse explains that Allah SWT spread out the earth like a carpet with the intention for it to be inhabited by humans and animals. He made the earth full of sustenance and food, whether in the form of animals, plants, or other things whose permanence is maintained until the Day of Judgement. Likewise, Allah SWT placed in the depths of the earth minerals, both visible and invisible, all of which are intended for humans. With the contents of the earth, humans can erect buildings, make jewelry from gold, silver, and other precious stones. Then, after that, humans make weapons of war, ships, and airplanes from iron and other minerals. At the end of this verse, Allah declares His power and the beauty of His creation by saying, "How good is what We have made, and how beautiful is what We have created."
text.49: Furthermore, Allah SWT explains that He created all kinds of events in different forms and with opposing characteristics. That is, everything is a counterpart or pair to another. He created happiness and misery, guidance and misguidance, night and day, heaven and earth, black and white, sea and land, darkness and light, life and death, paradise and hell, and so on. All of this is intended for humans to remember, be aware, and learn from everything, while Allah is One and does not need a partner. Thus, only Allah does not need others. So that we know that Allah is the One God who deserves to be worshipped and has no partners. He is the One who has the power to create everything and He is also the One who has the power to destroy it. He is also the One who has the power to create everything in pairs, in various types and forms, while His creatures are powerless and must realize this. An explanation regarding Allah creating everything in pairs according to scientific studies can be seen in the explanation of Surah asy-Syura/42: 11.
text.50: Therefore, mankind should seek refuge in Allah and hold fast to Him in all their affairs and problems by obeying all His commands and working for the purpose of obedience to Him. Allah SWT will then punish those who do not obey His commands. At the end of this verse, Allah commands His Messenger to affirm that he has indeed received a mandate from Allah SWT to convey to mankind that Allah SWT will retaliate with punishment against them for all violations of His commands, just as Allah SWT sent down His punishment upon previous nations.
text.51:
Then, in this verse, Allah swt forbids mankind from taking anything as an object of worship besides Him. Because everything other than Allah is not worthy of being worshipped. At the end of this verse, Allah swt commands His Messenger to affirm that he is truly a warner from Allah, to deliver a warning of Allah's punishment for anyone who makes a creature the object of worship and worships it. In a verse with a similar meaning, Allah swt says:

"So whoever would hope for the meeting with his Lord - let him do righteous work and not associate in the worship of his Lord anyone." (al-Kahf/18: 110)
text.52: In this verse, Allah explains that the Quraysh disbelieved Muhammad saw, accusing him of being a sorcerer or a madman. Similarly, previous communities had disbelieved their messengers. They said things similar to the words uttered by the disbelievers of Mecca. This was not a new thing in the history of mankind. All the messengers were disbelieved and harmed, but those messengers persevered until the help of Allah came. This verse serves as a comfort to the Messenger of Allah for all the suffering he experienced as a result of the rejection of the disbelievers of Mecca. They had become arrogant with material things that were blessings that glorified them. They were deceived by the postponement of God's punishment upon them. Therefore, all warnings and advice were of no benefit to them.
text.53: In this verse, Allah reproaches the disbelievers by saying, "Did those who disbelieved before advise those who came after them to deny Muhammad saw, and did those who came later truly accept and follow that advice?" They are indeed a rebellious people who transgress the limits in violating religious and rational provisions. Their rebelliousness is the binding cord between those who came before and those who came after, as if manifesting the existence of that advice.
text.54: Muhammad (peace be upon him) was commanded by Allah to turn away from them, and Allah explained that he was not to be blamed because He did not burden the Messenger of Allah to convert the disbelieving people of Mecca to Islam. His duty was only to convey the message (da'wah), and this he had already done.
text.55: This verse commands Muhammad saw to continue giving warnings and advice, because warnings and advice will be beneficial for those whose hearts are ready to receive guidance. It is narrated by Ibn Jarir, Ibn Abi Hatim, and al-Baihaqi that 'Ali bin Abi Talib said, "After verse 54 was revealed, namely when Allah commanded the Prophet Muhammad saw to turn away, everyone suspected that a calamity would befall. Then this verse 55 was revealed, and our feelings were relieved and our hearts were at ease."
text.56:
This verse affirms that Allah did not create jinn and mankind except to know Him and to worship Him. In this regard, Allah SWT states:

"While they were not commanded except to worship one God; there is no deity except Him. Exalted is He above whatever they associate with Him." (at-Taubah/9: 31)

This opinion is the same as that of az-Zajjaj, but other commentators are of the opinion that the meaning of the verse is that Allah did not create jinn and mankind except to submit to Him and to humble themselves. Thus, every creature, whether jinn or human, is obligated to submit to God's regulations, to humble themselves to His will, and to accept what He has decreed. They were created according to His will and given sustenance according to what He has determined. No one can provide benefit or cause harm because all of it is by the will of Allah. This verse reinforces the command to remember Allah SWT and commands people to perform worship to Allah SWT.
text.57:
In this verse, Allah explains that He will certainly not ask for their help for any benefit or harm, nor does He desire sustenance or to be given food like what employers do for their workers, because Allah does not need them. Rather, they are the ones who need Him in all their affairs. Allah is their Creator and their Provider. He is the One who possesses limitless power, ability, and strength. However, most people do not understand. Abu Hurairah narrated and said:

The Messenger of Allah said: "Allah said: 'O son of Adam, devote yourself to My worship and I will fill your heart with riches and cover your poverty. And if you do not do so (devote time to My worship), I will fill your heart with preoccupation (complexity) and I will not cover your needs (poverty).'" (Narrated by Ahmad from Abu Hurairah)
text.58:
In this verse, Allah explains that He will certainly not ask for their help for any benefit or harm, nor does He desire sustenance or to be given food like what employers do for their workers, because Allah does not need them. Rather, they are the ones who need Him in all their affairs. Allah is their Creator and their Provider. He possesses limitless power, ability, and strength. However, most people do not understand. Abu Hurairah narrated and said:

The Messenger of Allah said: "Allah said: 'O son of Adam, devote yourself to My worship, and I will fill your heart with richness and cover your poverty. And if you do not do (devote time to My worship), I will fill your heart with preoccupation (complexity) and I will not cover your need (poverty).'" (Narrated by Ahmad from Abu Hurairah)
text.59:
Allah SWT affirms that His threat is certain to occur, and it will occur on the Day of Judgment. Allah SWT states in this verse that whoever wrongs himself by busying himself with everything other than worshiping Allah SWT, associating partners with Allah SWT, and denying His Messengers, they will receive a portion of punishment like the portion received by previous nations who denied their messengers. Let them not ask Allah SWT to hasten His punishment because Allah SWT is not afraid of losing the opportunity. This is a response to those who are described by Allah in the verse:

"Then bring us what you threaten us with, if you should be truthful." (al-A'raf/7: 70)

In a verse with the same meaning as this verse, Allah says:

"The command of Allah is coming, so do not seek to hasten it." (an-Nahl/16: 1)
text.60: So woe to them for what they will encounter as punishments that have been promised to them on the Day of Resurrection; at that time, no one can help another, nor will they be helped.
